question:
(a) List ten types of flour used in catering.

(b) List six rising agents used in food preparation.
answer:

(b) Raising Agents Used in Food Preparation; (i) Yeast (ii) Sour milk (iii) Palm wine (iv) Air (v) Bicarbonate of soda (vi) Steam/water vapour (vii) Baking powder (viii) Cream of tartar

question:
Mr A and Mrs B walked into a restaurant to eat fish and beef dishes respectively.

(a) List six accompaniments suitable for Mr A.

(b) Mention four table wares appropriate for serving Mrs B.

(c) List six milk desserts suitable for Mr A and Mrs B.
answer:
(a) The accompaniments suitable for Mr A (fish dish); (i) Mayonnaise (ii) Tomato ketchup/sauce (iii) Pepper mill (iv) Banku (v) Kenkey (vi) Curry sauce (vii) Mustard sauce (viii) Cayenne (ix) Lemon segment (x) Yangi (xi) Tartar sauce (xii) Hollandaise sauce (xiii) Horse radish sauce

(b) Tablewares appropraite for serving Mrs B (beef dish); (i) Side plate (ii) Side knife (iii) Soup spoon (iv) Joint knife (v) Joint fork.

(c) Milk desserts suitable for Mr A and Mrs B (fish and beef dishes); (i) Egg custard (ii) Ice-cream (iii) Rice pudding (iv) Cream custard (v) Pan cake (vi) Milk pudding (vii) Milk candies (viii) Tiger nut mould (ix) Trifle (x) Fruit tool (xi) Cabinet pudding (xii) Souffle pudding (xiii) Bread and butter pudding (xiv) Milk and coconut jelly (xv) Bama pudding (xvi) Cream caramel/caramel custard (xvii) Bavarois

question: Outline eight procedures for the daily cleaning of an occupied hotel room.
answer: Procedures for the daily cleaning of an occupied hotel room; (i) Open the window (ii) Strip the bed (iii) Dust furniture and fittings (iv) (iv) Make the bed (v) Empty ash tray and waste basket (vi) Sweep and mop the floor (vii) Replace toiletries and towel (viii) Wash the bath tub/toilet and wash-hand basin.

question:
(a) Mention the four parts of salad 

(b) List the four ingredients used in mayonnaise preparation.

(c) State four points to consider when making stock.
answer:
(a) Parts of Salad; (i) Dressing (ii) Garnish (iii) Base (iv) Body

(b) Ingredients used in Mayonnaise Preparation; (i) Oil (ii) Egg yolk (iii) Seasoning/Flavouring (iv) Vinegar/Lemon juice

(c) Points to be considered when making stock; (i) Salt should not be added (ii) Fats should be skimmed off (iii) Soak the bone first when making chicken stock (iv) Stock should be skimmed gently (v) Avoid the use of unsound meat/bones/vegetables (vi) Strain, cook and keep in refrigerator if not used immediately (vii) Scum should be removed.
